themes: Recognition and support for legacy and heritage organizations
Barriers due to economic inequity and lack of access to space
Penalization of artists for success or visibility
Need for equitable and sustainable funding systems
key_phrases: artists and organizations be granted seats on funding committees
mentor emerging artists rather than compete with them
do not penalize artists for achieving visibility or success
affordable—or preferably free—access to rehearsal studios, performance spaces, and other necessary facilities
poverty remains a barrier to artistic development and access
funding system that honors legacy, supports sustainability, and fosters collaboration
barriers_identified: Competition between experienced and emerging artists for limited funding
Penalization for artist visibility or international recognition
Lack of affordable or free access to rehearsal and performance spaces
solutions_proposed: Grant artists and organizations seats on funding committees
Direct involvement of impacted groups in funding improvement initiatives
Creation of a dedicated Heritage Fund
Provide mentorship opportunities instead of competitive funding structures
Stop penalizing artists for visibility or success
Ensure affordable or free access to creative spaces
Institutional support for artists with a demonstrated capacity for community-based work
